Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: White Amphora
Description: This long amphora is provided with two handles by which it could be hung up by means of a rope. The handles start just below the rim and end at the amphora's shoulder. The mouth of the vessel is very narrow and the rim is marked with an incised line. The body is cylindrical in shape with a rounded base.
